page.title: 06BRADLEY SCHOOL
page.content: As you come down{Yew Tree lane}after you pass the{church and hall. }On the left stands the{school,}built in 1873.The{church}built it for the education of 140 pupils.This is quite astonishing when you see the amount of room provided inside.At present there are 46 pupils.The bell and tower still remain on the roof of the building but are no longer in use.At the back of the{ school}is a play ground which is used by the children.It has a climbing frame,hopscotch and two pitches for school games.In the centre the old toilet has been turned into a place for storing equipment. {The school}is not only used for educational purposes, nearly every Tuesday evening a youth club is held in{school}for{Bradley teenagers. {by Lucy Eade
